modmenu.descriptionTranslation.carpet_ig:
A Carpet Mod extension that contains some useful or useless functions and some functions that I want but are not included
Under the default configuration conditions, this mod will not change any vanilla behavior at all.
igny.command.enderchest.no_permission: You don't have permission to drop ender chest items
igny.command.enderchest.real_player_op_o: Only operators can drop ender chest items of real players
igny.command.fixnotepitch.success: Successfully changed %s note blocks to pitch %s
igny.command.playerOperate.vault_spawn_t: §7[PlayerOperate] §6Vault§c: Player §f%s §ccannot spawn fake player within §f%d §cseconds, stopping task
igny.command.customPlayerPickupItem.head: --- Pickup Config for %s ---
igny.command.customPlayerPickupItem.no_p: You do not have permission to modify other players' config
igny.command.CustomItemMaxStackSize.set_: Cannot set %s max stack to %s (must be greater than default)
igny.logger.piston.hover.position: Position: %s (Click to highlight this block for 10 seconds)
carpet.rule.playerMiningFatigueFreeGuard: Player Immune to Guardian Mining Fatigue
carpet.rule.wetSpongeCanAbsorbLava.desc: Wet Sponges can absorb lava (turn into dry sponges)
Permission to drop ender chest items
Usage: /player <name> drop all - drops inventory + ender chest (if permitted)
Usage: /player <name> drop inventory - drops only inventory items
Usage: /player <name> drop enderchest - drops only ender chest items
Without permission: 'all' drops only inventory items
With permission: 'all' drops both inventory and ender chest items
Real players: Only OPs can drop their ender chest items
Fake players: Follows the permission setting above
carpet.rule.noWardenDarkness.desc: Warden attacks no longer apply darkness effect to players.
carpet.rule.floatingIceWater.desc: Ice melts into water anywhere, even when floating in air.
carpet.rule.noZombifiedPiglinNetherPorta: When the Nether portal in the Overworld receives a random tick, zombified piglin will not naturally spawn in the Nether portal in the Overworld
carpet.rule.projectileDuplicationReintro: Reintroducing the projectile residual tick replication behavior from Minecraft versions below 1.21.2
carpet.rule.skeletonsPickupSwordsReintro: Reintroducing the skeleton pickup swords behavior from Minecraft versions below 1.21.4
carpet.rule.teleportInheritMinecartsMoti: Ports the feature from versions Minecraft 1.21-1.21.1 where minecars carrying passengers transfer their momentum to passengers during the teleport tick when crossing dimensions to version Minecraft 1.21.2 and above
Minecart entities with Infinity (Double.MAX_VALUE) momentum (Motion attribute) no longer work in Minecraft 1.21.11 and above; the allowInvalidMotion rule must be enabled for these versions
carpet.rule.tntMinecartEmptyDamageSource: Fixed the source of empty damage in TNT minecarts
carpet.rule.fakePlayerBoatYawFix.desc: Fake players will not correct yaw when riding boats.
When removing a fake player, remove the vehicle they are riding in.
cantrade: Remove the vehicle when there are no villagers or wandering merchants on it, and other entities remain the default
carpet.rule.candlePlaceOnIncompleteBlock: Candle can place on incomplete block
carpet.rule.commandFixnotepitch.desc: Adjust the pitch of the note blocks within the range to zero
carpet.rule.commandFixnotepitech.extra.0: Whether or not to generate block updated is controlled by the FixnotepitchUpdateBlock rule
carpet.rule.fixnotepitchUpdateBlock.desc: Control whether the CommandFixnotepitech rule generates block updated
carpet.rule.happyGhastNoClip.desc: Happy Ghast has players who ride while ignoring block collisions
carpet.rule.noWitherEffect.desc: Wither, Wither Skeleton, and Wither Rose cannot grant players the Wither effect
carpet.rule.locatorBarNoFakePlayer.desc: The locator bar does not show fake players
carpet.rule.fakePlayerLoginLogoutNoChatI: Fake players do not send login/logout messages to the chat
carpet.rule.commandPlayerOperate.desc: Use the /playerOperate command to manage player actions
carpet.rule.commandClearLightQueue.desc: Clears the light queue of the world
carpet.rule.fakePlayerNoBreakingCoolDown: Fake players keep breaking without a cooldown for breaking
carpet.rule.creativeDestroyWaterloggedBl: Creative players can destroy waterlogged blocks without generating water
carpet.rule.trialSpawnerCoolDown.desc: Customize the monster spawning cooldown after the trial spawner generates rewards
carpet.rule.optimizedEntityList.desc: Optimizes stacked living entities; separate each entity with a comma ',', set it to '#none' to disable it
carpet.rule.optimizedEntityList.extra.0: It disables most movement and squeezing calculations for these entities, improving performance.
carpet.rule.optimizedEntityLimit.desc: Enables optimization when the number of stacked entities reaches the value set by this rule. The entity must be included in the optimizedEntityList rule.
carpet.rule.playerOperationLimiter.desc: Enable operation limiter for players (real and fake).
Maximum number of blocks a real player can break per tick. Set to 0 to disable,Requires playerOperationLimiter to be enabled.
Maximum number of blocks a real player can place per tick. Set to 0 to disable,Requires playerOperationLimiter to be enabled.
Maximum number of blocks a fake player can break per tick. Set to 0 to disable,Requires playerOperationLimiter to be enabled.
Maximum number of blocks a fake player can place per tick. Set to 0 to disable,Requires playerOperationLimiter to be enabled.
carpet.rule.generateNetherPortal.desc: In the Overworld and Nether dimensions, using flint and steel or fire charges on obsidian and nether portal blocks allows you to place a nether portal perpendicular to the clicked block face
carpet.rule.generateNetherPortal.extra.0: Use the vanilla logic when sneaking and clicking
carpet.rule.generateNetherPortal.extra.1: If right-clicking the top or bottom face of an obsidian block, the generated nether portal will face the player's direction
carpet.rule.generateNetherPortal.extra.2: If right-clicking a nether portal block, placement is only allowed on its four side faces
carpet.rule.generateNetherPortal.extra.3: If the player is in creative mode, this rule can also be used in the End dimension
carpet.rule.placeComposterCompost.desc: When placing the composter, the compost level should be set to a value within the specified range, with a minimum of 0 and a maximum of 8,Triggered when the sneak button is pressed
carpet.rule.enderDragonDeathRiseLimit.de: Limits the maximum Y-coordinate the Ender Dragon can rise to after death. Set to -1145 to disable the limit.
carpet.rule.enderDragonDeathDropExp.desc: Sets the amount of experience dropped when the Ender Dragon dies. Set to -1 to use vanilla behavior.
carpet.rule.enderDragonDeathDropExp.extr: The first dragon kill grants 12,000 experience (set rule value to 12000).
Subsequent dragon kills grant 500 experience (set rule value to 500).
carpet.rule.instantSpawnEnderDragon.desc: Skips the respawn animation and instantly spawns the Ender Dragon when end crystals are placed to revive it.
carpet.rule.maxEndPortalSize.desc: Sets the maximum size of the End portal (minimum is 3). Set to -1 to use vanilla behavior.
carpet.rule.allowRectangularEndPortal.de: Allows rectangular End portals (each side must be at least 3 blocks long). Only effective when maxEndPortalSize is not -1.
carpet.rule.instantVaultSpawnLoot.desc: When generating loot from the vault, skip the animation and directly generate all loot
carpet.rule.trialSpawnerLootMultiplier.d: The loot multiplier after the trial spawner generates rewards
carpet.rule.trialSpawnerDropKeyProbabili: The probability of a Trial Key dropping as a loot from a Trial Spawner, Set to -1 to use vanilla behavior
carpet.rule.instantTrialSpawnerSpawnLoot: Skip the animation when the trial spawner generates loot, and directly spawn all the spoils
carpet.rule.simpleSoundSuppression.desc: Create an update suppressor based on 'IllegalArgumentException' by naming a Calibrated Sculk Sensor with a specified name.
carpet.rule.simpleSoundSuppression.extra: When the rule value is false, the rule is inactive.
When the rule value is true, Calibrated Sculk Sensors named '声音抑制器' or 'soundSuppression' can be used to create sound suppressors.
When the rule value is any other string, Calibrated Sculk Sensors named that string can be used to create sound suppressors.
carpet.rule.safeSoundSuppression.desc: When the sound suppressor has no redstone signal input, it has no effect.
carpet.rule.twoChangedRuleValueSetDefaul: When changing a rule value with the /carpet command, if the new value is the same as the previous one, reset it to the default.
carpet.rule.optimizedTNTErrorScopeFix.de: Fixes an issue where entities like Wind Charges have their explosions incorrectly optimized when optimizedTNT Rule is enabled.
carpet.rule.commandCustomPlayerPickupIte: Use /customPlayerPickupItem to control player custom pickup items
carpet.rule.commandCustomItemMaxStackSiz: Use /customItemMaxStackSize to control the maximum stack size of the item
The player's hunger value will not decrease
carpet.rule.playerLowHungryValueCanSprin: When the player's hunger level is below 7 points, they can sprint
carpet.rule.instantFrogEat.desc: Allows frogs to scan and instantly consume nearby edible entities every game tick
carpet.rule.allowInvalidMotion.desc: Allows entity motion (Motion attribute) to be Infinity (Double.MAX_VALUE), reverting the changes made in Minecraft 25w45a
carpet.rule.accelerateBabyVillagerGrowth: Players can feed baby villagers bread, carrots, potatoes, wheat, wheat seeds, beetroots, beetroot seeds, torchflower seeds, or pitcher pods to accelerate their growth.
Each feeding reduces the remaining growth time by approximately 10%. A minimum of 100 ticks is reduced per feeding, and feeding has no effect once the remaining growth time reaches 200 ticks.
Particles are displayed upon successful feeding.
carpet.rule.lightningBoltNoFire.desc: Lightning Bolt will not generate fire blocks or ignite entities.
carpet.rule.dispenserTrade.extra.0: Name the dispenser after the target villager's trade slot (number 1-10), then place it facing the villager.
carpet.rule.dispenserTrade.extra.1: Any single slot or combination of slots in the dispenser that fulfills the trade's currency requirement will trigger the trade.
carpet.rule.dispenserTradeFailDisperseIt: When a dispenser trade fails, do not eject the currency items; instead, cause the dispenser to fail its ejection attempt.
carpet.rule.renewableCalcite.desc: Using pointed dripstone to convert quartz blocks into calcite via random ticks
carpet.rule.pureShulkerBoxDispense.desc: When a dispenser places a dyed or renamed shulker box, it will be reverted to a regular, unnamed shulker box while preserving its contents
When loading a structure with structure blocks, the placed blocks do not trigger block updates
carpet.rule.spawnMaxCountIgnoresChunkOve: Count overlapping spawnable chunks between players towards the spawn cap, i.e. calculate the spawn cap based on online player count
